.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ExtenderControl extends System.Web.UI.Control implements class System.Web.UI.IExtenderControl
Public MustInherit Class ExtenderControl Inherits Control Implements IExtenderControl
public ref class ExtenderControl abstract : System::Web::UI::Control, System::Web::UI::IExtenderControl
type ExtenderControl = class inherit Control interface IExtenderControl

Docs.summary: Provides an abstract base class for an extender control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.ExtenderControl> class enables you to programmatically add AJAX functionality to an ASP.NET server control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.ExtenderControl> inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> class and implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IExtenderControl> interface. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> class defines the properties, methods, and events that are shared by all ASP.NET server controls. The <xref:System.Web.UI.IExtenderControl> interface is an abstract class, which you cannot instantiate directly. Instead, you create a derived type.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.ExtenderControl> class. For a tutorial related to this example, see [Creating an Extender Control](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/015b3b49-841a-4cd9-b80c-dfbddfc5be55).

Docs.param: An object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event and registers the extender control with the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks After the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender> event of the base class is raised, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.OnPreRender%2A> method registers the extender control with the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control.

Docs.param: The object that receives the server control content.
Docs.summary: Sends server control content to a provided object, which writes the content to be rendered in the browser window.
